product.name: 2-GALLON WHITE GLOSS KIT
product.description:
This product is a two-gallon, bright White, epoxy paint kit for coating and protecting pool surfaces.

The kit contains 1x gallon can of side-A White epoxy pigment, and 1x gallon of side-B catalyst.

It will cover approximately 500 - 600 sq. feet of surface area, depending on the application method.  This product kit can be brush or roll applied. To spray apply, you need to add some Epoxy Reducer #500.

product.name: Aluminum #80
product.description:
Klass Kote - Aluminum #80 - Side-A Epoxy

Aluminum Paint #80 is the side-A epoxy component ONLY.

Klass Kote Epoxy Aluminum Paint #80 requires equal amounts by volume of side-B catalyst component. It can be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463.

Aluminum Epoxy Paint #80 can be used as metal paint, aluminum boat paint, industrial machine paint, or anywhere else where an aluminum coating is required.  Aluminum Paint #80 is an excellent selection for metal paint. As paint for metal, it can be applied on primed or un-primed metal surfaces. Aluminum Paint #80 can be brush, roll, or spray-applied. It can also be used as aluminum paint for boats, brass paint, paint for steel, concrete paint, duck boat paint, and a host of other applications way too numerous to list here.

Please call us directly to discuss your particular application for our Aluminum Epoxy Paint #80
product.metatitle: Aluminum Paint, Metal Paint, Epoxy Paints, Aluminum Boat Paint
product.keywords: aluminum paint, metal paint, aluminum coating, aluminum boat paint, paint for metal
product.metadescription: Klass Kote ALUMINUM PAINT is a superior quality, 2-component, industrial strength, epoxy aluminum paint. Use on all surfaces. Brush or Spray, Small and Large quantities, Gloss and Satin finish

product.name: Aluminum #80 Kit with Reducer
product.description:
Klass Kote - Aluminum #80 Kit with Reducer
Industrial Maintenance Coating
Each kit contains all the epoxy paint you need for any resurfacing project that requires a tough, scratch-resistant, decorative, durable coating . The side-A epoxy, side-B catalyst, and epoxy reducer (thinner) if you want to spray-apply your project. 
Sizes...
Each 1-Pint Kit contains enough product to cover up to a 30-35 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1-Quart Kit contains enough product to cover up to a 60-70 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1/2-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 140-150 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 275-300 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 2-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 550-600 square foot surface area with 1 coat

product.name: Clear #40
product.description:
Klass Kote Epoxy Clear #40 is the side-A component of the Klass Kote Epoxy 2 part clear coat system.  This clear coat part-A epoxy paint is a catalyzed epoxy clear coat, and requires equal parts [by volume] of the part-B component.

For a glossy finish, choose our Gloss Catalyst #405 as your part-B catalyst component. For a more satin-like finish, choose our Satin Catalyst #463 as your part-B catalyst component.  When using Satin Catalyst #463, always be sure to shake it well, and mix it thoroughly up from the bottom of the can – before mixing it with the Clear #40 part-A epoxy component.  To achieve a “dead flat” clear coat look, consider adding some of our Flattener Additive.

After thoroughly mixing equal parts of the two components and allowing them to “induct” (let stand for a minimum of 30 – 45 minutes), Klass Kote Epoxy Clear Coats apply like any other conventional coatings.  It can be brushed, rolled, or spray-applied.  If you plan to spray-apply, you will need to thin your mixture to reduce it to spray viscosity by adding some Epoxy Reducer #500 – after letting the mixture induct.

Some suggested applications [surfaces] for Klass Kote Epoxy Clear Coats:
â— Metals â— Wood â— Concrete â— Aluminum
â— Fiberglass â— Glass â— Cloth â— Many Plastics
â— Steel â— Magnesium â— Lexan â— Brick/Stone
â— Porcelain â— Cement â— Pressboard â— Balsa Wood
â— Copper â— Brass â— Other Coatings â— Tile
product.metatitle: Industrial Strength Epoxy Clear Coat Paint System. Clear Epoxy Coating. Paint Garage Floor
product.keywords: Industrial Strength Epoxy Clear Coat Paint System. Clear Epoxy Coating. Paint Garage Floor
product.metadescription: 2-Part Industrial Strength Epoxy clear coat used for paint garage floor, clear epoxy coating

product.name: Custom Mixed Color (New, First Time) - Part A
product.description:
Klass Kote - Custom Mixed Color - Side-A Epoxy

THIS IS FOR NEW, FIRST TIME CUSTOM MIXES ONLY - If you want to order a repeat custom color, Monokote, Ultracote or Military FS color use the other custom color tab. 

This is the side-A epoxy component ONLY.

An equal amount by volume of side-B catalyst is required. It can be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463.

How to describe your custom color…
 
We are able to work from some other manufacturers color samples – they must be pastel-based, no fluorescents are available in our epoxy paint line. (Fluorescents, Mirages, Pearls, etc. can be found in our Urethane paint line). You may visit a Sherwin Williams or Home Depot and select from their color chip samples. Supply us with the color name and/or number and we will match that color. In a few cases we will need you to mail us the actual sample. We will notify you after you place your order if that is necessary.
 
You can check out the FEDERAL STANDARD Color Server and supply us with the color of your choice from the color picker there.
 
You can send us via US mail your pastel-based color sample. Be sure to include your phone number with your samples. 
 
Questions… call 612-243-1234 or email us.

variation.name: Custom Description
variation.summary: Enter your desired Custom Color description using one of the methods outlined above. Remember...this is the side-A epoxy component of the 2-part epoxy mixture.  It requires equal parts by volume of the side-B catalyst component. Part-B components can be found here.

This is the side-A epoxy component ONLY.

An equal amount by volume of side-B catalyst is required. It can be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463.

variation.name: Custom Description
variation.summary:
Please type in and describe the Custom Color you want. See our Color Formulae page for a list of some of the current custom colors we mix. If you don't see your color, please call or email us and request that we make it for you. If you have a link to your custom color, we may be able to work from a web image – just call us (612-243-1234)to work out the details.

We can also work from a sample that you send us from other manufactures color samples - so long as they are pastel-based colors. Example: Sherwin Williams or Home Depot color fans are possible choices. It may be necessary for you to mail us your color sample.

Along with superior performance and coverage these colors lay down flat and dry rapidly. Our 38+Striping Colors are available in a wide range of striking, vibrant colors. For best results use X-otic Colours part number 50-333 Slow Urethane Reducer for palleting.

product.name: Flattener Additive
product.description:
Klass Kote - Flattener Additive

This is an additive for use with either our Epoxy Paint or our Urethane Clear systems.  It is used to give a "dead flat" dried film look to epoxy, or a “satin-look” to urethane clear.

One half ounce of flattener additive will flatten about 1 to 1.5 quarts of epoxy paint or urethane clear mixture. It can either be added to the epoxy paint mixture of side-A & side-B components (must use Satin Catalyst #463 only, NOT for use with Gloss Catalyst #405)- or straight into the Satin Catalyst #463. For use in the urethane clear coats, add it to your mixture of side-A and side-B components - before you reduce the mixture.

Using more flattener will yield a more flat, more weathered-looking dried film. For epoxy usage it may be required to add some Epoxy Reducer #500 into the mixture, to get to the desired viscosity.

product.name: Gray Primer #50
product.description:
Klass Kote Epoxy Gray Primer #50 is the side-A epoxy component of the Klass Kote Epoxy 2-part epoxy primer/sealer coating system.  It requires equal parts [by volume] of the part-B catalyst component, either Primer Catalyst #415 or, in cases where faster dry times are required, Primer Catalyst White Fast #420. The same side-A primer/sealer is also available in White - Klass Kote Epoxy White Primer #55.

When using Gray Primer #50 with Primer Catalyst #415, first - thoroughly mix equal parts [by volume] of the two components and allow them to “induct” - let stand for a minimum of 30 – 45 minutes. If using Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, no induction (waiting) period is required.

After mixing, Klass Kote Gray Primer #50 applies like any other conventional primer coating.  It can be brushed, rolled, or spray-applied.  If you plan to spray-apply, you will need to thin your A & B mixture to reduce it to spray viscosity by adding some Epoxy Reducer #500. Add the reducer after the mixture has completed inducting (required only with Primer Catalyst #415).

Klass Kote Gray Primer #50 & White Primer #55 are high solids, catalyzed primers with excellent filling capabilities. They have been extensively field tested since 1964 on a host of varied substrates. Both Gray Primer #50 and White Primer #55 contain Zinc Phosphate as the anti-corrosive agent. On the ASTM B-117 test for rust creep-age away from x-scribe on a steel panel, Gray Primer #50 rated 10 on a scale of 0-10. (0-worst, 10-best), while White Primer #55 rated a 9.

These products are designed to be the first primer applied to bare substrates. White Primer #55 must be catalyzed with Klass Kote Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, while Gray Primer #50 can be catalyzed with either Primer Catalyst White Fast #420 or Primer Catalyst #415 – based on cure schedule requirements and shop conditions.

Please refer to the Klass Kote Primer Data Sheet for more detailed information about Gray Primer #50.

Some suggested applications [surfaces] for Klass Kote Epoxy Gray Primer #50:

â— Metals â— Wood â— Concrete â— Aluminum
â— Fiberglass â— Glass â— Cloth â— Many Plastics
â— Steel â— Magnesium â— Lexan â— Brick/Stone
â— Porcelain â— Cement â— Pressboard â— Balsa Wood
â— Copper â— Brass â— Other Coatings â— Tile

product.name: Gray Primer #50 Kit with Reducer
product.description:
Each Klass Kote Epoxy Gray Primer Kit contains everything you need to apply our outstanding, sand-able, score-filling, rust-inhibiting epoxy primer to your substrate.
Included in each kit is:
- 1x can of Side-A Epoxy Gray Primer
- 1x can of Side-B Primer Catalyst (choose either Regular #415 or Fast #420)  
- 1x can of Epoxy Reducer #500

When to use #420 Fast Catalyst - Use this catalyst in situations where fast dry times for your prime coat are required.  This is the ONLY Klass Kote epoxy catalyst component we sell that does not require an induction (waiting) period after mixing - before applying.

With Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, you mix it thoroughly with the side-A component, reduce it with Epoxy Reducer #500, then immediately strain it into your spray equipment or brush it on right away - no waiting.  With other Klass Kote Epoxy catalysts - you need to let the mixture sit (induct) for a minimum of 30 minutes before reducing it and applying.  Read Primer Data sheet for other difference between Reg and Fast Catalyst.

product.description:

This is the side-A epoxy component ONLY.

It requires equal amounts by volume of side-B catalyst component. It can be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463.

Indigo Blue #312 is currently the only product we do not make (grind from raw resin & pigments) in-house. As such, we are subject to pricing increases from our sources. Also note - this product is translucent, and may require several build-coats to attain complete, consistent coverage.

product.name: Klass Kote - Urethane Clear - Side-A Only
product.description:
Urethane Clear – Side-A Only:

- 1x - 3/4 part full can of part-A urethane clear

Klass Kote urethane clear represents the best in acrylic urethane technology. It is a hybrid polymeric blend of polyester and acrylic resins. As a protective, decorative, transparent top coat, Klass Kote Urethane Clear offers ultra violet (uv) protection, outstanding chemical & fuel resistance, flexibility, and extreme gloss retention.

Klass Kote Urethane Clear requires catalyzation with Klass Kote urethane catalyst part-B – which is included in each kit. The mixing ratio is 3 parts urethane clear part-A to 1-part urethane catalyst part-B. The mixture can then be thinned /reduced with Klass Kote Urethane Reducer before application.

category.path: Urethane Products / Urethane Clear Coat Products

product.name: Klass Kote - Urethane Clear - Side-B Only
product.description:
Klass Kote urethane clear represents the best in acrylic urethane technology. It is a hybrid polymeric blend of polyester and acrylic resins. As a protective, decorative, transparent top coat, Klass Kote Urethane Clear offers ultra violet (uv) protection, outstanding chemical & fuel resistance, flexibility, and extreme gloss retention.

This is the side-B catalyst component ONLY.

It is intended for use with Klass Kote Clear Urethane - Side-A. The mixing ratio is 3-parts urethane clear part-A to 1-part urethane catalyst part-B. The mixture can then be thinned /reduced with Klass Kote Urethane Reducer before application.

category.path: Urethane Products / Urethane Clear Coat Products

product.name: Klass Kote - Urethane Reducer - Slow
product.description:
Recommended for use with any of our basecoats, clears, candies, or pearls. Klass Kote Slow Reducer has staged release for proper flow out, leveling and gloss retention.

We have slow medium and fast reducers depending on how fast you want the materials to dry and what your temperature and humidity conditions are. The hotter the temperature, the slower you want your reducer - so that the materials don't dry too quickly. In colder temperatures, you will want a faster reducer that will help the materials to dry faster because the air temperature and humidity being cooler, are slowing your dry times. Currently we have these items in Â½ Pint, 1 Pint, 1 Quart, & 1 Gallon cans.

product.name: Klass Kote - Urethane Reducer - Slow - Medium - Fast
product.description:
Recommended for use with any of our basecoats, clears, candies, or pearls. Klass Kote Slow Reducer has staged release for proper flow out, leveling and gloss retention.

We have slow medium and fast reducers depending on how fast you want the materials to dry and what your temperature and humidity conditions are. The hotter the temperature, the slower you want your reducer - so that the materials don't dry too quickly. In colder temperatures, you will want a faster reducer that will help the materials to dry faster because the air temperature and humidity being cooler, are slowing your dry times. Currently we have these items in ½ Pint, 1 Pint, 1 Quart, & 1 Gallon cans.

category.path: Urethane Products / Urethane Clear Coat Products

It can be found on the U.S. Army Air Corps / U.S.A.F. page of the M&M Models Military Aircraft Color Guide.

product.name: Primer Catalyst #415
product.description:
Klass Kote - Primer Catalyst #415 - Side-B Catalyst Component

This is the Klass Kote Epoxy Paint - Primer Catalyst #415 - side-B catalyst mainly used with Klass Kote Epoxy Paint - Gray Primer #50 side-A epoxy. It can also be used with Klass Kote Epoxy Paint - White Primer #55 and will yield an "off white", pinkish primer color.

product.name: Primer Catalyst White Fast #420
product.description:
Klass Kote - Primer Catalyst White Fast #420 - Side-B Catalyst

This is the side-B catalyst component for use with Klass Kote Epoxy Primers side-A - either White Primer #55 or Gray Primer #50.

Use this catalyst in situations where fast dry times for your prime coat are required.  This is the ONLY Klass Kote epoxy catalyst component we sell that does not require an induction (waiting) period after mixing - before applying.

With Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, you mix it thoroughly with the side-A component (either White #55 or Gray #50), reduce it with Epoxy Reducer #500, then immediately strain it into your spray equipment or brush it on right away - no waiting.  With other Klass Kote Epoxy catalysts - you need to let the mixture sit (induct) for a minimum of 30 minutes before reducing it and applying.

product.description:
Klass Kote - Satin Catalyst #463 - Side-B Catalyst Component

This is the Satin side-B catalyst component and requires equal amounts of any (color or clear) side-A epoxy component.

Use this product when a satin-like, dried film is desired. Can be combined with Gloss Catalyst #405 to create a semi-gloss dried film. To create a "dead flat", weathered-look in your dried film, use this product with Catalyst Flattener Additive.

product.name: Urethane Clear Kit
product.description:
Each Klass Kote Urethane Clear Kit contains:

- 1x - 3/4 part can of part-A urethane clear

- 1x - 1/4 part can of part-B urethane catalyst

- 1x – 1x can of urethane reducer

Klass Kote urethane clear represents the best in acrylic urethane technology. It is a hybrid polymeric blend of polyester and acrylic resins. As a protective, decorative, transparent top coat, Klass Kote Urethane Clear offers ultra violet (uv) protection, outstanding chemical & fuel resistance, flexibility, and extreme gloss retention.

Klass Kote Urethane Clear requires catalyzation with Klass Kote urethane catalyst part-B – which is included in each kit. The mixing ratio is 3 parts urethane clear part-A to 1-part urethane catalyst part-B. The mixture can then be thinned /reduced with Klass Kote Urethane Reducer before application.

product.name: White Primer #55
product.description:
Klass Kote Epoxy White Primer #55 is the side-A epoxy component of the Klass Kote Epoxy 2-part epoxy primer/sealer coating system.  It requires equal parts [by volume] of the part-B catalyst component, either Primer Catalyst White Fast #420 (recommended) or, in cases where slower dry times are ok, Primer Catalyst #415. The same side-A primer/sealer is also available in Gray - Klass Kote Epoxy Gray Primer #55.

When using White Primer #55 with Primer Catalyst #415, first - thoroughly mix equal parts [by volume] of the two components and allow them to “induct” - let stand for a minimum of 30 – 45 minutes. If using Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, no induction (waiting) period is required.

After mixing, Klass Kote White Primer #55 applies like any other conventional primer coating.  It can be brushed, rolled, or spray-applied.  If you plan to spray-apply, you will need to thin your A & B mixture to reduce it to spray viscosity by adding some Epoxy Reducer #500. Add the reducer after the mixture has completed inducting which is required only with Primer Catalyst #415.

Klass Kote White Primer #55 & Gray Primer #50 are high solids, catalyzed primers with excellent filling capabilities. They have been extensively field tested since 1964 on a host of varied substrates. Both White Primer #55 and Gray Primer #50 contain Zinc Phosphate as the anti-corrosive agent. On the ASTM B-117 test for rust creep-age away from x-scribe on a steel panel, Gray Primer #50 rated 10 on a scale of 0-10. (0-worst, 10-best), while White Primer #55 rated a 9.

These products are designed to be the first primer applied to bare substrates. White Primer #55 must be catalyzed with Klass Kote Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, while Gray Primer #50 can be catalyzed with either Primer Catalyst White Fast #420 or Primer Catalyst #415 – based on cure schedule requirements and shop conditions.

Please refer to the Klass Kote Primer Data Sheet for more detailed information about Gray Primer #50.

Some suggested applications [surfaces] for Klass Kote Epoxy White Primer #55:

â— Metals â— Wood â— Concrete â— Aluminum
â— Fiberglass â— Glass â— Cloth â— Many Plastics
â— Steel â— Magnesium â— Lexan â— Brick/Stone
â— Porcelain â— Cement â— Pressboard â— Balsa Wood
â— Copper â— Brass â— Other Coatings â— Tile

product.name: White Primer #55 Kit with Reducer
product.description:
Each Klass Kote Epoxy White Primer Kit contains everything you need to apply our outstanding, sand-able, score-filling, rust-inhibiting epoxy primer to your substrate.
 
Included in each kit is:
 
- 1x can of Side-A Epoxy White Primer
- 1x can of Side-B Primer Catalyst (choose either Regular #415 or Fast #420*)  
- 1x can of Epoxy Reducer #500

*When to use #420 Fast Catalyst - Use this catalyst in situations where fast dry times for your prime coat are required.  This is the ONLY Klass Kote epoxy catalyst component we sell that does not require an induction (waiting) period after mixing - before applying.
With Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, you mix it thoroughly with the side-A component, reduce it with Epoxy Reducer #500, then immediately strain it into your spray equipment or brush it on right away - no waiting.  With other Klass Kote Epoxy catalysts - you need to let the mixture sit (induct) for a minimum of 30 minutes before reducing it and applying.  Read Primer Data sheet for other difference between Reg and Fast Catalyst. Sizes...

product.name: White Primer - #55 Kit with Reducer
product.description:
Each Klass Kote Epoxy White Primer Kit contains everything you need to apply our outstanding, sand-able, score-filling, rust-inhibiting epoxy primer to your substrate.
 
Included in each kit is:
 
- 1x can of Side-A Epoxy White Primer #55
- 1x can of Side-B Primer Catalyst (choose either Regular #415 or Fast #420*) 
- 1x can of Epoxy Reducer #500
 
*When to use #420 Fast Catalyst - Use this catalyst in situations where fast dry times for your prime coat are required.  This is the ONLY Klass Kote epoxy catalyst component we sell that does not require an induction (waiting) period after mixing - before applying.
With Primer Catalyst White Fast #420, you mix it thoroughly with the side-A component, reduce it with Epoxy Reducer #500, then immediately strain it into your spray equipment or brush it on right away - no waiting.  With other Klass Kote Epoxy catalysts - you need to let the mixture sit (induct) for a minimum of 30 minutes before reducing it and applying.  Read Primer Data sheet for other difference between Reg and Fast Catalyst.

product.name: White Tint Base #105
product.description:
Klass Kote - White Tint Base #105 - Side A Epoxy

This is the recommended side-A epoxy component for use when tinting other Klass Kote side-A epoxies. It contains less titanium than White #100 and is therefore better suited for tinting to achieve lighter tones.

Can be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463.

product.name: White Tint Base #105 Kit with Reducer
product.description:
Klass Kote - White Tint Base #105 kit with Reducer
Industrial Maintenance Coating
Each kit contains all the epoxy paint you need for any resurfacing project that requires a tough, scratch-resistant, decorative, durable coating . The side-A epoxy, side-B catalyst, and epoxy reducer (thinner) if you want to spray-apply your project. 
Sizes...
Each 1-Pint Kit contains enough product to cover up to a 30-35 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1-Quart Kit contains enough product to cover up to a 60-70 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1/2-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 140-150 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 1-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 275-300 square foot surface area with 1 coat
Each 2-Gallon Kit contains enough product to cover - up to a 550-600 square foot surface area with 1 coat

product.name: Yellow #160
product.description:
Klass Kote - Yellow #160 - Side-A Epoxy

This is the side-A epoxy component and requires equal amounts by volume of side-B catalyst component. It must be used with either Gloss Catalyst #405 or Satin Catalyst #463 in equal parts by volume.

Our Yellow #160 can be easily made into a "Cub" Yellow, by adding a very, very small amount (1 drop per few ounces) of any of our Red(s) - Bright Red #204 or Deep Red #206. You may also want to try a very tiny amount (a drop) of orange #250 in the Yellow #160 instead of (or with) the Red. If you need an Irox Yellow, choose either Identification Yellow - Shade 48 - FS #33538 or ID Yellow #162.
